revised_title: Foliation and Cleavage Patterns in North of Scotland Rocks
tldr: The author examines the arrangement of foliation and cleavage in rocks of the North of Scotland, proposing that these patterns form arches and are related to the geological features of the region. He also suggests that these contortions in gneiss and schist were formed when the rock matter was semi-fluid, allowing mineral ingredients to separate and re-arrange themselves under pressure.
